intro: Senecio ericoides, commonly known as the heath-like groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
